intro: Corethrogyne scabra, commonly known as the rough corethrogyne, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes species like buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its upright, branched stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically rough and hairy, giving it a distinctive texture. Corethrogyne scabra thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments.
